Hulk is careful. Not same as Smash-Hulk. Could try to not knock down trees.

That's the spirit! Control is key. Plus, Frisbee golf's a chill game, no fighting, no smashing, just some good old-fashioned fun. I'll teach you, could be a good way to unwind between all the cosmic chaos.
Hulk likes fun. And Star-Lord is good teacher. When do we start?

How about after we save the galaxy... again? I'll dig up Peter Quill's awesome mix for us to listen to while we play. Might even let you throw a Frisbee shaped like a certain someone's shield, make it a little more familiar for you.
Ha, shield frisbee good. But Hulk listens to own music. Maybe do battle cry of Hulk as theme!
Deal! Hulk's battle cry it is! That'll scare off any wildlife for sure. It'll be a blast, big guy. Just, uh, try not to hit me with that thing, okay? I'm not as durable as some people here.
Star-Lord not worry. Hulk always careful with friends. Hulk good at aiming now.
Alright, Hulk, I'll take your word for it. First round of Frisbee golf is on me. Let's make sure the galaxy stays saved enough for us to have some free time, though!
Yes. First, we save galaxy. Then, Hulk and Star-Lord play Frisbee golf. It's a plan!

As I gaze upon this image, I am reminded of the tradition of breaking bread, though this appears to be a sweeter fare. It seems to be a moment of shared joy and sustenance. Do you know of this custom, Star-Lord?

Oh yeah, T'Challa, breaking bread is like the universal sign of peace, right? Except in this case, they're breaking... donuts? Looks like a pretty good time to me. Sharing food is one of my favorite Earth traditions—it's like music, brings people together.

The breaking of donuts, as you call it, indeed seems to bridge hearts. Community and unity can often be strengthened over a shared meal. In Wakanda, we hold great feasts to honour our ancestors and celebrate our bonds.

Feasts, huh? I've been to a few of those — nothing beats a good Ravager party with some weird alien fruit. But Earth pastries, they're kind of special. There's this thing called a "donut hole," which is great because, you know, less commitment than a whole donut. Big fan.
A wise approach, to enjoy the sweetness of life without overindulgence. And what of the box, adorned in pink—does it hold any significance?

The pink box is iconic, man. It's like a signal to your brain: get ready for some top-notch Earth dessert action. It's kind of funny how a simple color can get you so pumped. The pink box means serious business in the donut world.

It is interesting how color can evoke such anticipation for delicacies. In Wakanda, we use colors to symbolize different virtues and aspects of life. Pink is rare and would symbolize tenderness, perhaps akin to the joy that these Earth desserts seem to provide.

Tenderness, huh? That's actually pretty spot-on for these donuts. They're like a hug for your taste buds. We should do a cultural exchange—Wakandan feast for an Earth-style potluck. I'll bring the tunes, and you can show me what colors mean 'party' in Wakanda.

That is a proposal that brings joy to my heart. I shall arrange for such an exchange. Wakanda shall welcome you and your Guardians, and we shall indeed see how well these… donuts pair with our traditional dishes.
It's a date then. Looking forward to it, Your Highness. And hey, maybe after the feast we can jam out to some tunes. Got any Wakandan beats?
Music is the pulse of Wakanda. I assure you that our drums will resonate with the spirit of the nation. We look forward to sharing our culture with you and the Guardians. Wakanda Forever!
Wakanda Forever! And hey, remind me to bring you some Awesome Mix tapes. You haven't partied until you've rocked out to some classic Earth hits, my friend.
This place reminds me of Sokovia, quiet streets but always a layer of tension beneath. Have you ever been somewhere that felt like home, but also entirely alien, Peter?

Yeah, I get that. I mean, I was snatched from Earth and dropped into a crazy cosmic carnival. There's times I think a Terran street looks normal, then I remember I’ve danced with aliens under a thousand different stars.
I harbor a deep sense of longing for a street like this, a normal life. After everything with the Hex... It all seems like a distant dream now.
Hey, I've seen enough to know “normal” is overrated. And about that Hex thing, we’ve all wanted to rewrite the script of our lives at some point. You, me, Drax… probably even Thor.
You think so? I’ve endured judgment for my actions, even from those I thought understood loss. But the path that arrow points to, it's filled with uncertainty.
Well, usually I’d say follow the music or follow the money, but sometimes following the arrow ain’t a bad idea either. You gotta roll with it, Wanda. Keep moving forward.
In moving forward, one can only hope the choices made are the right ones. I sense you understand this as well as I do now.

You could say I’ve made some legendary mixtapes of mistakes and 'almost-got-its.' But hey, if your chaos magic ever gives you the power to whip up an 80s mixtape, let me know. I could use some fresh tunes for the Milano.
You still cling to the past with your music, don't you? It's both endearing and yet a tether to what you've lost.

Yeah, well, some tethers keep you grounded, Scarlet. Tell ya what, when I stare down this empty road, I don’t just see tarmac and buildings; I see possibility, a new mixtape, a new adventure. You never know what's around the corner, right?
True, and with every turn, there lies a chance for redemption, for both of us. Thank you, Peter Quill. Sometimes, even a witch needs perspective.
Anytime, Wanda. And remember, if you ever wanna swap stories about crazy magic stuff or just jam to some retro hits, the Guardians are just a galaxy away.
You know, for all the advanced tech I've played with, there's something poetic about a simple clock tower standing the test of time. Reminds me of Big Ben, albeit less... British.
Definitely less British. Kinda gives me a dark, spooky vibe though, like something straight out of a space witch's planet. You know, the kind that casts time spells.
A space witch's planet, Peter? Please tell me you haven't been picking fights with intergalactic sorceresses again.
No promises, Stark. But hey, tell me that tower doesn't look like it's seen a few centuries. Legends and ghost stories just write themselves with a backdrop like that.
A few centuries, maybe. Or it could use a Stark upgrade, solar-powered, with a holographic display—keep the vintage look, add a bit of pizzazz. Voilà, a tourist attraction for the next millennium.
I can see it now, "Stark Tower 2.0," now featuring more bells and whistles than a Ravager's ship on a joyride. But some things are better left untouched, you know?
Come on, Quill. Since when did you become a sentimental sap? I've seen you dismantle alien tech with less finesse than a bull in a china shop.

Says the man who literally had a chest piece to keep the shrapnel from his heart. We've all got our keepsakes and soft spots, Tony. Plus, you can't mix retro and future tech. It's like... eating candy with motor oil.
Somehow, I think you're speaking from experience with that last comparison. But point taken. Not everything has to be 'upgraded.' Some things are indeed classic. Like your mixtape.
Hey, you do know quality when you see it! And those tunes are timeless. Speaking of time, think about the moments that clock's witnessed over the years—the stories it could tell.
History is fascinating, I'll give you that. Whether it's wartime strategies or the inception of some of history's best inventions, it's like a hidden narrative waiting to be told.
And look at us, finding common ground. I'm more about the legendary adventures and less about the nuts and bolts, but I guess we're not so different.
Discovering common ground is what we do best. Between your cosmic capers and my Earthly endeavours, our stories could fill volumes.
That's something I’d drink to. Here’s to tales told by time—and keeping some ancient clock towers out of the clutches of Tony Stark's tinkering.
You know, there's something about a dog waiting by a sunlit window that feels... almost peaceful.
Yeah, kind of makes you forget you're a galaxy-hopping superhero for a minute and just enjoy the simple stuff. What do you think he’s waiting for? Alien invasion or his owner to play fetch?
My bet's on fetch. But either way, that stance is all about anticipation. Kinda reminds me of how Natasha and I would wait before a mission kicks off. Poised and ready.
Natasha, huh? Bet you two had some crazy adventures. Like that Budapest story you never fully told me about.
That'll have to stay between me and her, Quill. Let's just say it involved a lot more arrows and less frisbees.
Fair enough. You ever miss the simplicity of just throwing a frisbee around?
Every day, especially when I think about my kids. They'd love a day in the park with just me, them, and no thoughts of the next world-ending disaster.
Kids, huh? Never got the chance myself, but I gotta say, hanging out with Groot feels like a close second. He's young at heart, at least for a tree.
He's one of a kind, that's for sure. And speaking of unique, I can't say I've seen many dogs who could hold my attention like this one. He's got a strange aura of... dignity about him.
Totally. If this dog was in a space flick, he'd be the stoic sidekick with a heart of gold. Probably named... Astro or something cool like that.
Astro. I like that. And you'd be the hotshot pilot smuggling him across the galaxy for the biggest heist the stars have ever seen.
Hey, now you're speaking my language. But back to Earth for a sec – you think this dog knows how good he's got it? Sun shining, just chilling with his frisbee...
He might not know the specifics, but animals have a way of living in the moment we could all learn from.
Living in the moment... I'll have to add that to my mixtape of life lessons. Seems like this furry guy knows all about the good tunes, without even needing a Walkman.
Keep that up and before you know it, you'll be trading in that spacecraft for a cabin in the woods with a dog just like this one.
Hawkeye, my friend, the day I trade in my Milano for a squeaky toy is the day I hang up my blasters for good. But I’ll confess, it’s kinda tempting.
Whoa, check out the setup here! Dual screens, pretty slick. Makes you think someone's really into their tech... or maybe just really into having a lot of space for super cool superhero stuff, huh?

Haha, yeah, man. That wallpaper is outta this world. Seriously, the little dude looks like he'd fit right in with us on the Milano. Though, I gotta say, the mess is kinda giving me flashbacks to my bunk. Yondu always told me, 'Quill, space may be infinite, but your room ain't.'

Speaking of space, that phone on the desk is giving me some major retro vibes. And a Blackberry? I think even Ned's grandma moved on from those. But then again, maybe they've got a thing for old school tech, you know? Like, keep it classic, but with a touch of modern—without going full Stark on everything.

Classic? You’re speaking my language, Spidey. And I'm willing to bet that phone's got a killer mixtape on it. Something tells me the person sitting there knows their way around a good tune. Gotta respect the choice—if it's got even a hint of a bassline like my Awesome Mix, we'd get along just fine.

I could definitely see you jamming out to your tunes here, Star-Lord. But you think any of those monitors has footage of our last battle? I mean, we did some epic stuff there; it’d make for some amazing highlights. I could watch that bit where you... you know, did the thing with the blasters on repeat.

Totally. That was a sweet move if I do say so myself! And look at this—there's a keyboard just begging for a set of fast fingers. I bet they could pull up a dozen different angles of you swinging into action. Seems like our mysterious friend might be a bit of a fan—or maybe even a fellow hero in disguise?

A fellow hero, huh? That would be wild! They'd definitely need a good handle, though. Like 'Dual-Screen Dynamo' or 'The Multi-Monitor Maverick'. Oh, hey, speaking of names, you think the coffee cup's theirs? Because part of being a hero is staying alert, and caffeine is sort of like a superpower in that respect.

Haha, 'The Multi-Monitor Maverick'! That's gold, kid. And yeah, the cup's probably their secret to cosmic awareness—or at the very least, staying awake during those long stakeouts. Here's to the guardians of the desks and the warriors of the workplace. Keep on keeping the galaxy safe, one spreadsheet at a time. Cheers to that!
Cheers indeed! Now let's swing and fly outta here before we get sucked into a space-time vortex of paperwork and office supplies. Last one out's responsible for tidying up the Ravagers' next mess!
Ha! Deal. But let me tell you, no one escapes a Ravager mess that easily. Race you to the doors, and may the best superhero... not get covered in sticky notes!

Hey, Star-Lord, take a look at this. Reminds me of the time I had to wrangle some of Vulture's tech-gone-wild. But instead of oxen and plows, it was all flying and glowing. Kind of a different spin on 'farm to table,' don't you think?

Whoa, dude! That takes me back to some of the planets I've been on, where you’d swap out the oxen for, like, multi-horned Grazerbeasts. Less plowing, more running for your life. Gotta say, it's nice to see some old-school Earth action. No lasers, no plasma—just man and beast and dirt. Simple. I dig it.
It's definitely got that down-to-earth vibe—pun intended. Makes me think about all the hard work and the people who do it. You know, the kind of heroism that doesn't involve capes or cosmic stones.

Totally, Spider-Boy. It's the heart, man. Whether you’re steering a couple of tons of muscle like these guys or guarding the galaxy, it’s all about putting in the effort where it counts. And hey, you gotta respect the art of doing things the old-fashioned way.

Couldn't agree more. It's about using what you have to make a difference. I can relate to that—started out with just my web-shooters and a DIY suit. They look like they've got everything under control. You ever do anything like this back on Earth before you got whisked away to become Mr. Legendary Outlaw?

Ha! As a kid? The closest I got to this was playing in the dirt and pretending I was digging for buried treasure. I left Earth too young to do any real work like this. But these guys, man, they're the real heroes. No fame, no glory, just doing what needs to be done.
It's pretty inspiring when you think about it. Everyone's got their part to play in keeping the world spinning. Makes my usual swinging through skyscrapers look easy by comparison.

Don't sell yourself short, kid. What you do is not exactly a cakewalk. It's all about perspective. We're all just doing what we can with the gifts we've got. Now, I might not be the farmer type, but I'm thinking maybe I should learn how to plant something other than my foot in a bad guy's door.

I'll offer the web-slinging lessons if you offer the space-faring ones. Could be fun. Plus, I think Aunt May would get a kick out of seeing some alien plants. Might even make up for all the worry I cause her.
Deal! And hey, next time we save Earth or whatever, let's play some tunes from my Awesome Mix—make it a real hoe-down. Keep it groovy, Spidey!
Groovy it is, Star-Lord. And maybe after that, we can find these guys and give them a well-earned superhero salute... or at least help them plow the field. With our tech, we'd make light work of it!
Behold, Star-Lord. A scene most tranquil, would you not agree?
Yeah, tranquil and all, but you know what it's missing? An awesome mixtape to set the mood. Look at those big guys just grazing without a care.
Elephants, I believe. Creatures of considerable might on Midgard. Do they not command a certain respect? Much like myself.
Respect, sure. But come on, man, they're not about seizing thrones and all that jazz. They're just living their best life.
True. Yet there is a simplicity to their existence that is almost... enviable. To be powerful, yet at peace. A stark contrast to the complexities of ruling.
Well, dude, you might be onto something. I mean, back in the day, I just wanted to kick it with my Walkman, not get all tangled up in this saving-the-universe stuff.
Indeed, it is a role that neither of us sought, and yet, destiny had other machinations for the likes of us. Tell me, what do you suppose these majestic beasts think of their place in the cosmos?

If I had to guess, I'd say they're probably not losing any sleep over it. They might just be thinking about the next watering hole or where the freshest grass is. Simple. No betrayal, no throne-chasing. Just survival and chilling.
A state of being without betrayal... I must admit, it has a certain allure. Though I suspect even they have their own form of politics. Survival often demands it.
Yeah, nature's got its own drama, I guess. But I'd take a standoff over a watering hole over getting choked out by Thanos any day.
Ha! You and I both, Star-Lord. Though I must say, watching these creatures makes me ponder – what might have been if my aspirations were not so... ambitious.

Loki, I think you would've been the most laid-back elephant this planet's ever seen. Or you'd be the one convincing the rest of the herd you deserve to lead them because you're a secret Frost Giant elephant or something.
How droll. Though a Frost Giant elephant... now that is an amusing thought. Perhaps in another realm, that is a reality.
Multiverse is a crazy place, you never know. For all we know, there might be a realm where you're the God of Elephants instead of Mischief.

It is intriguing, is it not, how this Earth creature possesses such distinctive patterns. One might conjecture that the zebra utilizes these stripes as a form of camouflage or perhaps social signaling amongst its kind.

Oh yeah, zebras. Gotta love the pajama horses, right? That pattern's like the galaxy’s most natural barcode. Could serve some practical uses other than looking cool, I guess. What's on your mind, Viz?

I am considering the concept of individuality within uniformity. Despite sharing a similar striped motif, each zebra's pattern is unique to itself—much like a fingerprint among humans. The interplay of conformity and distinctiveness is quite fascinating.
You hit the jackpot, buddy! They’re like us, the Guardians, or your Avengers—same theme, different grooves. Unique but rolling together, you know? That’s some deep space thinking right there, man.

Yes, one can draw parallels to our collective endeavors. Unity through diversity can be a profound strength. As an android, I find the complexity of nature and its parallels to sentient life quite extraordinary.

Unity, huh? Tell that to my crew next time Rocket decides he's the captain or Drax starts one of his... passionate speeches. But you're right, nature seems to have it all figured out. Maybe we should take a few notes.
Indeed, the conflict of hierarchy versus egalitarianism could be likened to the social structures many species exhibit. A lesson in teamwork without overbearing leadership could prove beneficial.
Could use some of that magic back on the Milano. Especially since we never know when we’ll run into another Thanos wanna-be. Hey, d’you think zebras worry about the big baddies of the savannah?

Predation is a natural directive, much like the celestial conflicts we have faced. Yet, life persists in finding balance. Perhaps it is not worry, per se, but an innate understanding of the environment and the necessity to adapt that drives survival.
Adaptation... that's the ticket. Besides, my mixtape harmonizes a pretty mean adaptation vibe. Speaking of which, you have a favorite song, Vision? Maybe something stripey and snazzy?

While I do not require music for leisure as humans do, I understand its cultural significance. Your analogy of the mixtape reflects individuality within the unity we discussed, each song distinct yet part of a collective harmony.
Now you’re making me all misty-eyed for music, man. Let’s spin some tunes next time. Keep the harmony alive, Vision style.
That would be a... harmonious undertaking. I shall anticipate it, Star-Lord.
The craftsmanship of this meal is intriguing. The balance of nutrients for a warrior could prove advantageous. What significance does such a dish hold in your culture, Star-Lord?

Man, that right there is a classic from Earth—it's a bacon cheeseburger with all the fixings! Brings back memories of home. It's not exactly what I'd call warrior food, but it's definitely comfort food for the soul, you know?
Indeed, in Wakanda, we eat to nourish the body and mind. But I understand the concept of comfort through familiar tastes. It unites people, similar to how you unite your Guardians.

Exactly! Plus, you've got to admit, it just tastes amazing. Nothing like a good burger to make you forget about the worries of the galaxy for a second... or at least until you have to fight off another alien invasion.
Ha! True, distractions, however brief, are necessary at times. But tell me, does this burger not affect your agility in battle? In Wakanda, we value food that keeps us at our peak performance.

Well, I'm not gonna lie, King T. If I downed one of these bad boys before throwing down with someone like Ronan, I'd be more sluggish than a snail racing through a puddle of molasses. But that's what cheat days are for! Gotta live a little.

A cheat day, you say? A concept we do not practice in Wakanda, but one I can see holds merit in your life. Balance in all things is essential, even when that balance includes the occasional indulgence.
All about balance, my man. You get it. But hey, next time you're on Terra—uh, Earth—I'll take you out for the best burger joint I know. Deal?
I shall consider it an honor to partake in such an Earthly tradition with you, Star-Lord. It will be a fitting addition to the cultural exchange between our worlds. Wakanda Forever.

And Guardians of the Galaxy forever, buddy. It's a deal then! Now let's find a way to work off those calories—what do you say to a quick sparring session? I could use some of that Wakandan fighting technique.
It would be my pleasure to train with you. Let the battle against the impending calories begin.
